alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 16 at 5:59AM PST until December 16 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * CHANGES...Updated for additional snow amounts for remainder of this morning. * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches above 7000 feet along the Sierra Crest, and up to 3 inches below 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph in valley locations with up to 80 mph along Sierra Ridges. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds will produce wave heights of 2 to 3 feet on Lake Tahoe. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult with poor visibility at times from falling and blowing snow. The hazardous conditions will impact this morning`s commute. Long delays are likely. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
